Dating: 22ND DYNASTY (not before); 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD; 26TH DYNASTY (not after)
Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL; FAYENCE; GLAZED
Name: Anepigraphic shabti of Pasenhor
Description: Shabti of Pasenhor in the clothing of the living and in a walking position. He is wearing a short wig and short skirt. He has a whip in his right hand, the left arm is down his side next to the body. Although there is no inscription, we know that it belonged to this man because it was found together with other shabtis which did bear inscriptions.
